video.title: From wireframe to website prototype - Webflow Tutorial
video.description:
How to build a prototype in Webflow.

Webflow is a responsive website design tool that let's you build websites in the browser. In this Webflow tutorial I show you a step by step process for taking a concept for a website or app and creating a responsive, interactive prototype in Webflow.

Tutorial from Robert Smith. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpzWITCC0EjA9tiKeyO1i3A

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: NICK CORNETT
topLevelComment.text: I have a wireframe, that I need to convert to a landing page, I have very little experience.  Is there a program that will convert it to a webpage for me, or is there somewhere I can go and get someone to do it for a reasonable price?  I want to use the landing page wireframe because it converts at almost 7%.  But I am very new to this sort of thing.  Thanks!

topLevelComment.author: John Leigh
topLevelComment.text: The ready made webflow container has a max width of 940px which is a decent setup but to be more flexible you can create your own using a centered div that you set the max width yourself to a value that best suits your design - for example perhaps 1000px max width will be a better bet for the site you have in mind - gives a bit more width to play with but still provides that nice layout of a centered column

topLevelComment.author: Flip Back
topLevelComment.text: okay so you dragged a Section first and then instead of dragging the Container module you dragged in a Div instead and named it the inner container? What is the difference between that and using the built-in Container module? Should we be avoiding it?
